Content_wSideColumn.BodyCopy:
We appreciate your interest in Kinder Camp. Due to the increase in the number of students at BYU-Idaho, our department resources are being reassigned to other areas. We will no longer be able to offer many of the programs that we used to provide.  Read Letter to the Community for more information.

We would like to thank you for your past support of our programs. We have had many enjoyable years and appreciate the contributions and value that you brought to our programs. If you are still interested in this type of program, we suggest that you look for other alternatives provided by BYU-Idaho or the community.

Some links to websites with information about alternatives to this program are listed below:

  • Rexburg Library
  • City of Rexburg Recreation programs

Kinder Camp

Community Connection's seeks to inspire participants to adopt a goal of continued lifelong learning through prepared activities, team work, and the joy of play. This recreational based program will teach children to have fun while encouraging age appropriate growth.

The Kinder Camp program provides a safe variety of activities designed to incorporate the BYU-Idaho learning model.  All actives are supervised by trained, responsible staff.  An integral part of the daily activities include socialization and character development through crafts, games, and outdoor play.  They include fun activities which incorporate health and wellness.

Kinder Camp fits within BYU-Idaho's mission of striving to provide a quality education for students of diverse interests and abilities, and to maintain a wholesome academic, cultural, social and spiritual environment.

Come join us for animal week! Children will learn and have fun in this Kinder Camp program, which encourages age appropriate growth for your child.

What is Kinder Camp:

  • Five-day program
  • Camp counselors are selected from BYU-Idaho students
  • All activities are supervised by trained, responsible staff
  • Socialization and character development
  • Daily activities include crafts, games, and outdoor play

Who: Children ages 4 - 6.

Cost: $35 per child per week. Cost includes all supplies for activities.

"Our hope is that more people will feel connected to the miracles taking place on this campus..." - President Kim B. Clark.
